title: Increasing and decreasing with particle motion

content.question: The acceleration of a particle moving along the x-axis is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGHbWdamaabmaabaWdbiaadshaa8aacaGLOaGaayzkaaWdbiaa bccacqGH9aqpcaqGGaWdamaabmaabaWdbiaadshacqGHsislcaaI4a aapaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8qacaWGZbGaamyAaiaad6gacaqGGaGaamiD aiaabccaaaa@458F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo>≤</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>8</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaaIWaGaaeiiaiabgsMiJkaabccacaWG0bGaaeiiaiabgsMiJkaa bccacaaI4aaaaa@3E81@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> . At what value of t is the particle’s velocity decreasing most rapidly?
